itemDescription: English civil servant and social investigator

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Hubert Llewellyn Smith  (1864 – 19 September 1945) was a British civil servant. He served as permanent secretary to the Board of Trade from 1907 to 1919, where he played an important role in the Liberal government's welfare reforms. He also served as the chief economic advisor to the government from 1919 to 1927.
